meanings.sent1: In spring, the garden is full of colorful flowerage.
meanings.sent2: The flowerage in the meadow was a beautiful sight.
meanings.sent3: The flowerage seemed to dance in the gentle breeze.
meanings.sent4: Her smile was like a burst of flowerage in a gray world.
meanings.sent5: The flowerage bloomed with vibrant hues, painting the landscape.

meanings.definition: The collective flowers of a plant or area.
meanings.sent1: The flowerage of the rose bush attracted many bees.
meanings.sent2: She picked a bouquet from the flowerage in the garden.
meanings.sent3: The flowerage in the vase brightened up the room.
meanings.sent4: The flowerage in the park was a sea of colors.
meanings.sent5: The flowerage swayed gently in the summer breeze.
